title: The Question Festival

dialogue.speaker: Festival Organizer
dialogue.text: *addressing the crowd* Welcome to our annual celebration of not-knowing! Today we honor questions without seeking answers!

dialogue.speaker: Poet
dialogue.text: *on stage* My offering: 'What is the color of why? How deep does wonder grow? Who dreams the dreamer's dream?'

dialogue.speaker: Crowd
dialogue.text: *cheering* More questions! More questions! Let uncertainty reign!

dialogue.speaker: Philosopher
dialogue.text: *laughing* Ten years ago, I would have tried to answer every question here. Now I just want to roll in them like autumn leaves!

dialogue.speaker: Child with Balloons
dialogue.text: *releasing balloons with questions written on them* Fly, questions! Maybe the sky knows what to do with you!

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: *to Sage* Look how far we've comeâ€”from fearing questions to celebrating them. Evan would have loved this.

dialogue.speaker: The Memorial Tree
dialogue.text: *decorated with question marks that sparkle in sunlight* Every leaf a question, every branch reaching toward mystery, every root deep in not-knowing.

scene_context: The Questions Quarter hosts its annual festival celebrating uncertainty, where the community gathers to honor questions without demanding answers, transforming doubt into celebration.
philosophical_theme: Joy in uncertainty and communal celebration of mystery
visual_elements: Festive decorations made of question marks, balloons carrying questions skyward, people dancing with uncertainty
